content:

transformative experience is required to generate the sort of movement earliest
Christianity was . . .“**N. T. Wright, an eminent British scholar, concludes, “That is
why, as an historian, I cannot explain the rise of early Christianity unless Jesus rose
again, leaving an empty tomb behind him.“†
Therefore, it seems to me, the Christian is amply justified in believing that
Jesus rose from the dead and was who he claimed to be. But that entails that
God exists.
5: God can be immediately known
